questions.text: Normal thyroid weight varies……..with dietary iodine content (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Normal weight of thyroid gland is inversely related to the dietary iodine. Iodine is a raw material which is needed for thyroid hormone production. If there is sufficient amount of iodine present in the blood patients thyroid gland can work efficiently with easy availability of iodine so thyroid gland is of normal size. If there is deficiency of iodine then cells of thyroid gland have to work more so there occurs an enlargement of the thyroid gland.

questions.text: Isthmus of thyroid gland overlies the: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Thyroid gland is situated in the neck. Isthmus of thyroid gland lies in the neck and is situated just below the cricoid cartilage . Isthmus of thyroid gland lies over 2rd, 3rd and 4th tracheal cartilaginous rings.

questions.text: Thoracic extension of cervical goiter is usually approached through: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Most of the retrosternal goiters start their development in neck and then they tend to grow in the mediastinum. As they start their development in the neck they derive their blood supply from the vessels in the neck. So they are managed through the incisions in the neck. Thoracotomy is required for the retrosternal goiters who primarily develop in the mediastinum and if they have developed other vessels around the thyroid . Thoracoscopic route is primarily not preferred for retrosternal goiter.

questions.text: Thyroid storm after operation is due to: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) whenever you have to operate on a patient who has either a hyper or hypothyroidism we have to make sure that patient has become euthyroid before we take the patient for operation and we take measures to work in that direction. The reason being surgery is a stressful event for patients body and if the patient has not become euthyroid before the surgery patient can present with excessive release of thyroid hormone and give rise to thyroid storm. So Thyroid storm after operation most commonly occurs due to inadequate control of hyperthyroidism. Option B is not the answer as massive bleeding in the intraoperative period is not the cause of thyroid storm in the post operative period . Option C is not the answer as recurrent laryngeal nerve injury if occurs in intraoperative period it will lead to respiratory distress in the post operative period and not thyroid storm. Option D is not the answer as post operative infection can lead to reactionary hemorrhage and not thyroid storm.

questions.text: The best marker to diagnose thyroid related disorder is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The ultrasensitive TSH assay has become the most sensitive and specifc test for the diagnosis of hyper- and hypothyroidism and for optimizing T4 therapy. The enhanced sensitivity and specifcity of TSH assays have greatly improved laboratory assessment of thyroid function. The reason being in any of the thyroid disease may it be hypo or hypothyroidism, TSH values are first to be altered and thus if you want to chose one option from the above mentioned options TSH is the answer for this.

questions.text: Toxic adenoma on scanning appear as: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Hyperthyroidism from a single hyper functioning nodule typically occurs in younger patients. On RAI scanning it shows a hot nodule with suppression of the rest of the thyroid gland.

questions.text: All of the following conditions are associated with hyperthyroidism, except: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A that is hashimoto`s thyroiditis is associated with transient hyperthyroidism initially Option B that is graves disease, it is the Most Common cause of hyperthyroidism, caused by stimulatory autoantibodies to TSH-R Option C is toxic multinodular goiter and it is one of the important cause of hyperthyroidism. Option D Reidel Thyroiditis:- hypo thyroidism is seen

questions.text: After thyroidectomy of medullary carcinoma of thyroid, which is important for determining recurrence of tumour? (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option C is the answer in this question as in case of medullary carcinoma of thyroid we use calcitonin and CEA as a tumor marker. Option A is not the answer in this case as thyroglobulin is used as a tumor marker for differentiated thyroid malignancies like papillary and follicular carcinoma of thyroid. Option B and D is wrong as TSH and thyroxine values have nothing to do with the tumor recurrence.

questions.text: MEN-2 is seen with the following type of thyroid carcinoma: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option B is correct as 10-25 % of medullary carcinoma of thyroid can be familial and they are associated with MEN II syndrome Papillary carcinoma of thyroid has a tendency to occur in the thyroglossal cyst and in patients who have radiation exposure in the cervical region early in their life. Option D is not the answer in this case as follicular carcinoma of thyroid occurs in patients who have had a long standing goiter over a period of time. Option C is anaplastic carcinoma and is not associated with MEN II Syndrome.

questions.text: Which of the following gene defects is associated with development of medullary carcinoma of thyroid?
questions.solution: Correct answer (A) around 20% of patients of medullary carcinoma thyroid are familial and are associated with MEN Syndrome and have an underlying RET proto oncogene mutation. Option B is not the answer as FAP gene is associated with familial adenomatous polyposis and not medullary carcinoma of thyroid. Options C and D are not the answer as they are not associated with medullary carcinoma of thyroid.

questions.text: Amount of I-131 given for carcinoma thyroid: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Amount of I131 given for carcinoma thyroid is 50 milli curie (30-100 mCi).

questions.text: Thyroid carcinoma causes laryngeal paralysis due to: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The nerves are found in close relationship to thyroid gland and therefore likely to be involved in malignant spread nerves involved during thyroid surgery are recurrent laryngeal nerve and superior laryngeal nerve.

questions.text: Which sign has been shown in the figure ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Trousseau sign of latent tetany is a medical sign observed in patients with low calcium. This sign may be positive before other manifestations of hypocalcemia such as hyperreflexia and tetany, as such it is generally believed to be more sensitive (94%) than the Chvostek sign (29%) for hypocalcemia. To elicit the sign, a blood pressure cuff is placed around the arm and inflated to a pressure greater than the systolic blood pressure and held in place for 3 minutes. This will occlude the brachial artery. In the absence of blood flow, the patient's hypocalcemia and subsequent neuromuscular irritability will induce spasm of the muscles of the hand and forearm. The wrist and metacarpophalangeal joints flex, the DIP and PIP joints extend, and the fingers adduct. Option B. The Chvostek sign is a clinical sign of existing nerve hyperexcitability (tetany) seen in hypocalcemia. It refers to an abnormal reaction to the stimulation of the facial nerve. When the facial nerve is tapped in front of tragus the facial muscles on the same side of the face will contract momentarily (typically a twitch of the nose or lips) because of hypocalcemia (i.e. from hypoparathyroidism, pseudohypoparathyroidism, hypovitaminosis D) with resultant hyperexcitability of nerves. Option C. Troisier’s sign is enlarged left supraclavicular lymph node seen in intra abdominal malignancies Option D. Trousseau Syndrome is migratory thrombophlebitis seen in patients with intra abdominal malignancies. Most commonly associated with pancreatic Ca.

questions.text: Name the sign demonstrated in the following figure :
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The Pemberton maneuver is a physical examination tool used to demonstrate the presence of latent pressure in the thoracic inlet. Most commonly seen in retrosternal goitre but can be seen in superior vena cava syndrome as well. The maneuver is achieved by having the patient elevate both arms until they touch the sides of the face. A positive Pemberton's sign is marked by the presence of facial congestion and cyanosis, as well as respiratory distress after approximately one minute

questions.text: A 42-years-old man undergoes surgery for medullary carcinoma of the thyroid. After the surgery, he complains of a “noisy quality” to his voice. This condition was most likely caused by damage to the:
questions.solution: Correct answer (B) The recurrent laryngeal nerves are branches of the vagus (CN X), and supply all intrinsic muscles of the larynx except the cricothyroid. The right recurrent laryngeal nerve recurs around the right subclavian artery. The left recurrent laryngeal nerve recurs in the thorax around the arch of the aorta and ligamentum arteriosum. Both nerves ascend to the larynx by passing between the trachea and esophagus, close to the thyroid gland.

choices.text: Rough Handling of thyroid during operative period

questions.text: Which of the following is the reason for Post op thyroid storm.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Thyroid storm refers to High T3 and T4 in circulation. Thyroid storm is an acute exacerbation of acute Hyperthyroidism. It can occur before Sx , during Sx or after Sx. Causes are as follows: A) Inadequate preparation with drugs before thyroidectomy (Most common cause) B) Stress C) URTI D) Rough handling of the gland causing release of the thyroid hormone,but it is not the most common cause. 5) Discontinuation of propranolol immediately after Sx.

questions.text: Most common mediastinal tumor:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Neurogenic tumors ( M/C occur in posterior Mediastinum ) are the M/C mediastinal tumors in children .

questions.text: Inferior thyroid artery supplies which structures 1. Esophagus 2. Thymus 3. Thyroid 4. Parathyroid
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Inferior thyroid artery supplies:- 1. upper part of Esophagus 2. Thymus 3. Inferior part of Thyroid 4. All four Parathyroids

questions.text: A 30 years old female patient presented with complaints of palpitation and feeling febrile all the time with midline neck swelling. On examination, a diffusely enlarged thyroid is felt and lower border of swelling is seen moving with deglutition. Exophthalmos was also noted. What are the essential investigations to be done? 1. Thyroid scan 2. FNAC 3. Thyroid function test 4. USG neck 5. Anti-Thyroid antibody
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The given case scenario is s/o Thyrotoxicosis,secondary to Graves disease. 1. Thyroid scan is done to look for uptake. 2. FNAC is not needed in case of grave's disease as it is invasive and diagnosis can be done by clinical and radiological investigations. 3. Thyroid function test is done to look for increased T3 AND T4 and decreased TSH. 4. USG neck will reveal diffuse enlargement of thyroid. 5. Anti-Thyroid antibody is also sent to aid the diagnosis.

questions.text: Which drug is used to reduce bleeding from thyroid?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Propranolol decreases T4 to T3 conversion but do not reduce bleeding. Option B-PTU inhibits thyroid peroxidase and decreases T4 to T3 conversion but do not reduce bleeding. Option C-Lugol’s iodine (KI) Makes thyroid gland less vascular due to vasoconstriction & less functional.It is given 10 to 14 days prior to surgery. Option D-Methimazole inhibits thyroid peroxidase but do not reduce bleeding.

questions.text: Which of the following will not result in hoarseness of voice after a thyroid surgery?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Dissecting/retracting strap muscles will not result in hoarseness of voice after a thyroid surgery as do not play a direct role in voice production. Option B-Exploring beahr's triangle can lead to injury to RLN. Option C-Tubercle of zuckerkandl dissection can lead to injury to RLN. Option D-Ligating superior thyroid vessels can lead to injury to ELN.

questions.text: MOST DANGEROUS NERVE INJURY IN THYROID SURGERY-
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Most dangerous nerve injury in thyroid surgery is bilateral RLN complete injury as it will cause adduction of both vocal cords resulting in breathing difficulty.

questions.text: A patient presents with a painless swelling of the neck. The histology of the tissue is as given in the image below. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Hashimoto's thyroiditis Hashimoto's thyroiditis is the leading cause of hypothyroidism in iodine-sufficient areas, characterized by autoimmune destruction of the thyroid gland. Commonly affects women aged 45-65, presenting with painless thyroid enlargement and potential thyrotoxicosis due to autoantibody damage. Diagnosis involves low T3 and T4, elevated TSH, and specific autoantibodies. Management includes thyroid hormone replacement. Long-term goiter may lead to compressive symptoms, thyroid lymphoma, or increased risk of papillary thyroid carcinoma, sometimes requiring total thyroidectomy.

questions.text: A 40-year-old female presents with fever, fatigue, diffuse painful swelling in the midline of the neck, FNAC of the same reveals epitheloid cells and giant cells, the likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Subacute thyroiditis The presence of fever, fatigue, diffuse painful swelling in the midline of the neck, and FNAC revealing epithelioid cells and giant cells suggests a granulomatous process. The most likely diagnosis in this case is Subacute thyroiditis (also known as De Quervain's thyroiditis) often presents with pain, fever, and findings on FNAC that include giant cells. While tubercular lymphadenitis (option c) could also present with similar symptoms, the specific mention of epitheloid and giant cells in the neck swelling aligns more closely with subacute thyroiditis.
